Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.telemetry.metrics

OpenTelemetry Metrics implementation for Gumdrop.

This package provides a lightweight implementation of OpenTelemetry Metrics, enabling collection and export of metric data from Gumdrop servers and applications.

Instrument Types

Synchronous Instruments - recorded at measurement time:

  • LongCounter - monotonically increasing counter
  • LongUpDownCounter - bidirectional counter
  • DoubleHistogram - distribution of values

Asynchronous Instruments - callback-based, invoked at collection time:

  • ObservableGauge - point-in-time value
  • ObservableCounter - async monotonic counter
  • ObservableUpDownCounter - async bidirectional counter

Usage Example

 // Get a meter from TelemetryConfig
 Meter meter = telemetryConfig.getMeter("org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http");

 // Create a counter
 LongCounter requestCounter = meter.counterBuilder("http.server.requests")
     .setDescription("Total HTTP requests received")
     .setUnit("requests")
     .build();

 // Create a histogram for latency
 DoubleHistogram latencyHistogram = meter.histogramBuilder("http.server.duration")
     .setDescription("HTTP request latency")
     .setUnit("ms")
     .setExplicitBuckets(5, 10, 25, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000)
     .build();

 // Create an observable gauge
 meter.gaugeBuilder("http.server.active_connections")
     .setDescription("Currently active connections")
     .buildWithCallback(new ObservableCallback() {
         public void observe(ObservableMeasurement measurement) {
             measurement.record(server.getActiveConnectionCount());
         }
     });

 // Record measurements in request handling
 requestCounter.add(1, Attributes.of("http.method", "GET", "http.status_code", 200));
 latencyHistogram.record(45.2, Attributes.of("http.method", "GET"));

Aggregation Temporality

Metrics can be exported with different temporalities:

  • DELTA - Values represent change since last export. Preferred for push-based systems and stateless collectors.
  • CUMULATIVE - Values represent total since process start. Preferred for Prometheus-style scrapers and pull-based systems.

Configure the temporality in the TelemetryConfig: 

 <property name="metrics-temporality-name">delta</property>

Export

Metrics are automatically collected and exported via the OTLP exporter at the configured interval (default: 60 seconds). The export endpoint can be configured: 

 <property name="metrics-endpoint">http://localhost:4318/v1/metrics</property>
 <property name="metrics-interval-ms">30000</property>
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
TelemetryConfig, OTLPExporter
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Instrument
    Base interface for all metric instruments.
    ObservableCallback
    Callback interface for observable instruments.
    ObservableMeasurement
    Interface for recording measurements in observable instrument callbacks.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Attributes
    An immutable collection of attributes for metric measurements.
    DoubleHistogram
    A histogram for recording distributions of double values.
    DoubleHistogram.Builder
    Builder for DoubleHistogram.
    HistogramDataPoint
    A single data point for a histogram metric.
    LongCounter
    A monotonically increasing counter for long values.
    LongCounter.Builder
    Builder for LongCounter.
    LongUpDownCounter
    A counter that can increase or decrease.
    LongUpDownCounter.Builder
    Builder for LongUpDownCounter.
    Meter
    Factory for creating metric instruments.
    MetricData
    Represents an aggregated metric ready for export.
    MetricData.Builder
    Builder for MetricData.
    NumberDataPoint
    A single data point for a counter or gauge metric.
    ObservableCounter
    An asynchronous monotonic counter that reports values via callback.
    ObservableCounter.Builder
    Builder for ObservableCounter.
    ObservableGauge
    An asynchronous gauge that reports point-in-time values via callback.
    ObservableGauge.Builder
    Builder for ObservableGauge.
    ObservableUpDownCounter
    An asynchronous up-down counter that reports values via callback.
    ObservableUpDownCounter.Builder
    Builder for ObservableUpDownCounter.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AggregationTemporality
    Defines how metric values are aggregated over time.
    MetricData.Type
    The type of metric data.
